p: The physical examination was tachycardia, tachypnoea with the respiratory rate of 28 breaths per minute and a temperature of 38°C. Results of the arterial blood gas performed while the patient was breathing room air were as follows: pH, 7.39; PaCO 2, 40 mmHg; PaO 2, 56 mmHg; and peripheral oxygen saturation, 90%. Lungs examination revealed bilateral lower zone crepitations. Other blood investigations which included a complete blood count, comprehensive metabolic panel, and lactate were unremarkable. She was initiated on broad‐spectrum antibiotics, oseltamivir, intravenous hydrocortisone 50 mg every 8 h, and 12 L/min (FiO2: 60%) of high‐flow oxygen supplement. However, she developed right‐sided pneumothorax and worsened respiratory failure 12 h later.
